successful_checks.details:
Section 2.1
It SHALL have the av01 brand among the compatible brands array of the FileTypeBox

Section 2.1
It SHOULD indicate a structural ISOBMFF brand among the compatible brands array of the FileTypeBox, such as iso6

Section 2.1
It SHALL contain at least one track using an AV1SampleEntry

Section 2.2.4
The width and height fields of the VisualSampleEntry SHALL equal the values of max_frame_width_minus_1 + 1 and max_frame_height_minus_1 + 1 of the Sequence Header OBU applying to the samples associated with this sample entry.

Section 2.2.4
The width and height in the TrackHeaderBox SHOULD equal, respectively, the maximum RenderWidth, called MaxRenderWidth, and the maximum RenderHeight, called MaxRenderHeight, of all the frames associated with this sample entry.

Section 2.2.4
The config field SHALL contain an AV1CodecConfigurationBox that applies to the samples associated with this sample entry.

Section 2.3.4
The marker field SHALL be set to 1.

Section 2.3.4
The value SHALL be set to 1 for AV1CodecConfigurationRecord.

Section 2.3.4
The seq_profile field indicates the AV1 profile and SHALL be equal to
the seq_profile value from the Sequence Header OBU.

Section 2.3.4
The seq_level_idx_0 field SHALL be equal to the value of seq_level_idx[0] from
the Sequence Header OBU.

Section 2.3.4
The seq_tier_0 field SHALL be equal to the value of seq_tier[0] from the Sequence Header OBU.

Section 2.3.4
The high_bitdepth field indicates the value of the high_bitdepth flag from the
Sequence Header OBU.

Section 2.3.4
The twelve_bit field indicates the value of the twelve_bit flag from the
Sequence Header OBU. When twelve_bit is not present in the Sequence Header
OBU the AV1CodecConfigurationRecord twelve_bit value SHALL be 0.

Section 2.3.4
The configOBUs field SHALL contain at most one Sequence Header OBU and if present, it SHALL be the first OBU.

Section 2.3.4
ConfigOBUs: the flag obu_has_size_field SHALL be set to 1.

Section 2.3.4
When a Sequence Header OBU is contained within the configOBUs of the
AV1CodecConfigurationRecord, the values present in the Sequence Header OBU
contained within configOBUs SHALL match the values of the
AV1CodecConfigurationRecord.

Section 2.3.4
The timing_info_present_flag in the Sequence Header OBU (in the configOBUs field or in the associated samples) SHOULD be set to 0.

Section 2.4
The sample data SHALL be a sequence of OBUs forming a Temporal Unit

Section 2.4
Each OBU SHALL follow the open_bitstream_unit Low Overhead Bitstream Format
syntax as specified in [AV1]. Each OBU SHALL have the obu_has_size_field set
to 1 except for the last OBU in the sample, for which obu_has_size_field MAY be
set to 0, in which case it is assumed to fill the remainder of the sample

Section 2.4
OBU trailing bits SHOULD be limited to byte alignment and SHOULD not be used for padding

Section 2.4
OBUs of type OBU_TILE_LIST SHALL NOT be used.

Section 2.4
OBUs of type OBU_TEMPORAL_DELIMITER, OBU_PADDING, or OBU_REDUNDANT_FRAME_HEADER SHOULD NOT be used.

Section 2.4
If an AV1 Sample is signaled as a sync sample (in the SyncSampleBox or by
setting sample_is_non_sync_sample to 0), it SHALL be a Random Access Point
as defined in [AV1], i.e. satisfy the following constraints:
- Its first frame is a Key Frame that has show_frame flag set to 1,
- It contains a Sequence Header OBU before the first Frame Header OBU.

Section 2.4
In tracks using the AV1SampleEntry, the ctts box and composition offsets in
movie fragments SHALL NOT be used.

Section 2.4
In tracks using the AV1SampleEntry, the is_leading flag, if used,
SHALL be set to 0 or 2.

unchecked.details:
Section 2.2.4
Additionally, if MaxRenderWidth and MaxRenderHeight values do not equal respectively
the max_frame_width_minus_1 + 1 and max_frame_height_minus_1 + 1 values of the
Sequence Header OBU, a PixelAspectRatioBox box SHALL be present in the sample entry

Section 2.3.4
The sample entry SHOULD contain a colr box with a colour_type set to nclx.
If present, the values of colour_primaries, transfer_characteristics, and
matrix_coefficients SHALL match the values given in the Sequence Header OBU (in
the configOBUs field or in the associated samples) if the
color_description_present_flag is set to 1. Similarly, the full_range_flag in
the colr box shall match the color_range flag in the Sequence Header OBU. When
configOBUs does not contain a Sequence Header OBU, this box with colour_type set
to nclx SHALL be present.

Section 2.3.4
The CleanApertureBox clap SHOULD not be present.

Section 2.3.4
For sample entries corresponding to HDR content, the
MasteringDisplayColourVolumeBox mdcv and ContentLightLevelBox clli SHOULD be
present, and their values SHALL match the values of contained in the Metadata
OBUs of type METADATA_TYPE_HDR_CLL and METADATA_TYPE_HDR_MDCV, if present (in
the configOBUs or in the samples).

Section 2.4
Intra-only frames SHOULD be signaled using the sample_depends_on flag set to 2.

Section 2.4
Delayed Random Access Points SHOULD be signaled using sample groups and the
AV1ForwardKeyFrameSampleGroupEntry.

Section 2.4
Switch Frames SHOULD be signaled using sample groups and the AV1SwitchFrameSampleGroupEntry.

Section 2.4
If a file contains multiple tracks that are alternative representations of the
same content, in particular using Switch Frames, those tracks SHOULD be marked
as belonging to the same alternate group and should use a track selection box
with an appropriate attribute (e.g. bitr).

Section 2.4
Metadata OBUs may be carried in sample data. In this case, the
AV1MetadataSampleGroupEntry SHOULD be used.

Section 2.4
If the metadata OBUs are static for the entire set of samples associated with a
given sample description entry, they SHOULD also be in the OBU array in the
sample description entry.

Section 2.8.4
metadata_specific_parameters is only defined when metadata_type is set to
METADATA_TYPE_ITUT_T35 in which case its value SHALL be set to the first 24 bits
of the metadata_itut_t35 structure. For other types of metadata,
its [metadata_specific_parameters] value SHOULD be set to 0.

validation.version:
ISO Base Media File Format
MPEG-4 part 12 - ISO/IEC 14496-12 - m17277 (6th+FDAM1+FDAM2+COR1-R4)

unchecked.details: Section 4.3.1: the major_brand should be repeated in the compatible_brands list

Section 12.1.3.2
CleanApertureBox 'clap' and PixelAspectRatioBox 'pasp' in VisualSampleEntry

Section 8.11.3: Item location box
Data offset integrity: check we don't point out of the file.
This is rather a safety check than a formal rule.

Section 8.1.1: Media Data box (track)
Data offset integrity: check we don't point out of the file.
This is rather a safety check than a formal rule.

Section 8.11.12.1
Zero or one 'iref' box per MetaBox

Section 8.11.14.1
Each ItemPropertyAssociationBox shall be ordered by increasing item_ID,
and there shall be at most one occurrence of a given item_ID, in the set of
ItemPropertyAssociationBox boxes

Section 8.11.14.1
There shall be at most one ItemPropertyAssociationBox with a given pair of
values of version and flags

Section 8.11.14.1
ItemPropertyContainerBox: flags should be equal to 0 unless there are more than
127 properties in the ItemPropertyContainerBox

Section 8.11.14.1
ItemPropertyContainerBox: version 0 should be used unless 32-bit item_ID values
are needed

Section 4.2
if size is 0, then this box shall be in a top-level container, and be the last box in that container

Section 6.1.2
The sequence of objects in the file shall contain exactly one presentation
metadata wrapper (the MovieBox).

Table 1: box structure and arity
This is rather a safety check than a formal rule.

Section 4.3.1
The 'ftyp' box shall be placed as early as possible in the file (e.g. after any
obligatory signature, but before any significant variable-size boxes such as a
MovieBox, MediaDataBox, or FreeSpaceBox).

Section 8.4.3.1
'hdlr box': pre_defined = 0.

Section 8.4.3.1
'hdlr box': reserved = 0

Section 8.4.3.1
'hdlr box': 'name' field shall be null-terminated.
